drug.name: Aniline
drug.description: Aniline, phenylamine or aminobenzene is an organic compound with the formula C6H5NH2. Consisting of an amine attached to a benzene ring, aniline is the prototypical aromatic amine. Being a precursor to many industrial chemicals, its main use is in the manufacture of precursors to polyurethane. Like most volatile amines, it possesses the somewhat unpleasant odour of rotten fish. Aniline is colorless, but it slowly oxidizes and resinifies in air, giving a red-brown tint to aged samples.
drug.synthesis-reference: Michel Dury, "Method for preparing 2-trifluoro-methoxy-aniline." U.S. Patent US6121492, issued 0000.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as aniline and substituted anilines. These are organic compounds containing an aminobenzene moiety.

article.citation: Sousa MO, Miranda TL, Costa EB, Bittar ER, Santoro MM, Figueiredo AF: Linear competitive inhibition of human tissue kallikrein by 4-aminobenzamidine and benzamidine and linear mixed inhibition by 4-nitroaniline and aniline. Braz J Med Biol Res. 2001 Jan;34(1):35-44.

polypeptide.name: Kallikrein-1
polypeptide.specific-function: Glandular kallikreins cleave Met-Lys and Arg-Ser bonds in kininogen to release Lys-bradykinin.

go-classifier.description: regulation of systemic arterial blood pressure

article.citation: Thier R, Lewalter J, Selinski S, Bolt HM: Biological monitoring in workers in a nitrobenzene reduction plant: haemoglobin versus serum albumin adducts. Int Arch Occup Environ Health. 2001 Sep;74(7):483-8.

polypeptide.name: Serum albumin
polypeptide.specific-function: Serum albumin, the main protein of plasma, has a good binding capacity for water, Ca(2+), Na(+), K(+), fatty acids, hormones, bilirubin and drugs. Its main function is the regulation of the colloidal osmotic pressure of blood. Major zinc transporter in plasma, typically binds about 80% of all plasma zinc.

go-classifier.description: bile acid and bile salt transport
hemolysis by symbiont of host erythrocytes
negative regulation of programmed cell death

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome P450 2E1
polypeptide.specific-function: Metabolizes several precarcinogens, drugs, and solvents to reactive metabolites. Inactivates a number of drugs and xenobiotics and also bioactivates many xenobiotic substrates to their hepatotoxic or carcinogenic forms.

go-classifier.description: intrinsic component of endoplasmic reticulum membrane
oxidoreductase activity, acting on paired donors, with incorporation or reduction of molecular oxygen, NAD(P)H as one donor, and incorporation of one atom of oxygen
oxidoreductase activity, acting on paired donors, with incorporation or reduction of molecular oxygen, reduced flavin or flavoprotein as one donor, and incorporation of one atom of oxygen
